explanations: This expression is used to make suggestions or give advice
Since V (た-form) + ほうがいい includes the meaning of comparing two things and selecting one of them, it implies that it would be bad to not take the action specified by the verb
When simply recommending a certain action, ~たら いい (Lesson 26) is used
examples: 1) 毎[まい]日[にち] 運[うん]動[どう]した ほうが いいです。
1) You'd better take some exercise some day
2) 熱[ねつ]が あるんです。
2) I've got a fever
2) ... じゃ，あふろに 入[はい]らない ほうが いいです。
2) ... In that case, you better not take a bath

explanations: This expression is used to express an opinion about something in the future or something uncertain, without being definite
examples: 1) 明[あ]日[した]は 雨[あめ]が 降[ふ]るでしょう。
1) It will probably rain tomorrow
2) タワポンさんは 合[ごう]格[かく]するでしょう。
2) I wonder when Thawaphon will pass
2) ... きっと 合[ごう]格[かく]するでしょう。
2) ... I'm sure he will pass

forms: V (じしょ-form) + かも しれません
い-Adj + かも しれません
な-Adj + かも しれません
Noun + かも しれません
explanations: This expression is used to point out that there is a possiblilty, however small of ~
examples: 1) 約[やく]束[そく]の 時[じ]間[かん]に 間[ま]に 合[あ]わない かも しれません。
1) We might not get there in time for the appointment

explanations: This expression is used to convey the speaker's intention to the listener and is used when announcing an action
It has a more assertive tone than V (ます-form) + ましょうか
examples: 1) エンジンの 音[おと]が おかしいんですが。
1) The engine sounds weird
1) ... そうですね。故[こ]障[しょう]が もしれません。ちょっと 調[しら]べましょう。
1) ... I see. Maybe there is a problem with the engine. Let's check it out.

explanations: This shows a time limit or other limit
examples: 1) 駅[えき]まで 30分[ぶん]で 行[い]けますか。
1) Can we get to the station in 30 minutes?
2) 3万[まん]円[えん]で パソコンが 買[か]えますか。
2) Can you buy a computer for 30,000 yen?

topic: 何[なに]か 心[しん]配[ない]な ことが あるんですか
explanations: This expression is used to ask if there is anything that the listener is worried about
